clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Effect of Root Canal Preparation by TF and M-Pro on Post-Operative Pain After Single Visit Endodontic Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Effect of Root Canal Preparation by TF and M-Pro on Post-Operative Pain After Single Visit Endodontic Treatment: A Blinded Randomized Clinical Trial Therapeutic Study.

brief_summary.textblock: A study to comparatively evaluate the post operative pain between root canal preparation by reciprocating file (TF) and full rotation file (M-Pro) in patients with single rooted teeth with acute irreversible pulpits.

detailed_description.textblock: Teeth with symptomatic irreversible pulpitis are selected according to the eligibility and exclusion criteria and patients are then randomized to receive treatment after using Twisted files or M-pro files. The treatment is done in single visit. The postoperative pain is then assessed using the Numerical Rating Scale 6,12, 24 and 48 hours post-instrumentation.

primary_outcome.description: Post-operative pain assessed after treatment using the NRS pain scale

arm_group.description: Use of twisted file during cleaning and shaping of root canals
Use of Mpro file during cleaning and shaping of root canals

intervention.description: Use of twisted file during cleaning and shaping of root canals
Use of Mpro during cleaning and shaping of root canals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients in good health (American Society of Anesthesiologists Class II or higher).
- Patients having symptomatic irreversible pulpitis in their single rooted teeth.
- Age range is between 20 and 60 years.
- Patients who can understand numerical rating scale (NRS).
- Patients able to sign informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with positive percussion test.
- Patients having history of necrosis with or without apical pathosis.
- Patients have sinus tract or fistula extra oral or intraoral.
- Pregnant or mentally retarded patients.
- Teeth with grade 2 or 3 mobility.
